(48) 39%d February, 1948CABINETPOLITICAL ACTIVITIES OF CIVIL SEEVANTSMemorandum by the Prime MinisterAT their meeting on 15th January (CM. (48) 4th Conclusions, Minute 3)the Cabinet considered a memorandum by the Chancellor of the Exchequer(CP. (48) 15) recommending that there should be an independent enquiry intothe restrictions imposed on the political activities of civil servants. The cabinet agreed to resume their consideration of this recommendation when they had beforethem the proposed composition of the Committee.2. I have discussed the matter with the Lord President and the Chancellorof the Exchequer, and suggest that the Committee should be constituted asfollows : Chairman Sir Philip Morris.Members Sir Ronald Adam.The Hon. Sir Edward Cadogan.Mr. "William Cash.Dame Myra Curtis.Lord Dukeston.The Right Hon. Sir Richard Hopkins.Sir Miles Mitchell.Professor W. A. Robson.The Right Hon. Graham White.3. No change is contemplated in the terms of reference, which would be : " To examine the existing limitations on the political activities (both national and local) which may be undertaken by civilian Government staffs and to make recommendations as to any changes which may be desirable inthe public interest."C. R. A.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1.2nd February, 1948.34877
